verses.roman:
kānyakubja-dākṣiṇātyera vaidika brāhmaṇa
dainya kari, kare mahāprabhura nimantraṇa

synonyms: kānyakubja—brāhmaṇas from Kānyakubja; dākṣiṇātyera—certain brāhmaṇas from South India; vaidika—followers of the Vedic religion; brāhmaṇa—brāhmaṇas; dainya kari—with great humility; kare—do; mahāprabhura—of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; nimantraṇa—invitation.
translation: The brāhmaṇas from different places, such as Kānyakubja and South India, who were all strict followers of the Vedic religion, offered invitations to Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu with great humility.
